item.title: 米色报告》就谁为关税买单发出多重警告
item.description: 自美国总统唐纳德-特朗普上任以来，美国企业从未如此强烈地表达过提高关税的影响。事实上，他们的话语权是2018-19年中美贸易战期间的两倍多。【原文：Not since US President Donald Trump’s first term have American businesses been this vocal about the impact of higher tariffs. In fact, they have more than twice as much to say as they did during the US-China trade war of 2018-19.】

item.title: 美国支持国际货币基金组织和世界银行引发 "松了一口气
item.description: 我是克里斯-安斯蒂（Chris Anstey），在华盛顿报道国际货币基金组织/世界银行会议的经济编辑。今天我们将关注美国财政部部长对国际货币基金组织和世界银行的评论。请将反馈和建议发送至 ecodaily@bloomberg.net。如果您尚未注册接收本新闻通讯，请点击此处。【原文：I’m Chris Anstey, an economics editor in Washington for the IMF/World Bank meetings. Today we’re looking at the US Treasury chief’s comments on the IMF and World Bank. Send us feedback and tips to ecodaily@bloomberg.net. And if you aren’t yet signed up to receive this newsletter, you can do so here.】

item.title: 美国与盟国在国际能源署峰会上就能源安全愿景发生冲突
item.description: 在本周举行的能源安全旗舰国际峰会上，美国及其盟国的观点冲突一览无余。【原文：At this week’s flagship international summit on energy security, the clashing visions of the US and its allies were on full display.】

item.title: 巴基斯坦通过驱逐外交官和停止贸易回击印度
item.description: 在克什米尔发生枪手杀害数十名游客事件后，这两个拥有核武器的竞争对手之间的紧张局势急剧升温，巴基斯坦以牙还牙，降低了与印度的外交关系等级，将印度外交官驱逐出伊斯兰堡，并停止了有限的贸易往来。【原文：Pakistan downgraded diplomatic ties with India in a tit-for-tat response, expelling Indian diplomats from Islamabad and stopping the limited trade as tensions flare up between the two nuclear-armed rivals after gunmen killed dozens of tourists in Kashmir.】

item.title: 俄罗斯驳回 Raiffeisen 就 20 亿欧元法院命令提出的上诉
item.description: 德国莱法森国际银行股份公司（Raiffeisen Bank International AG）对法院判决提出上诉，法院命令该公司向受制裁的俄罗斯亿万富翁奥列格-德里帕斯卡（Oleg Deripaska）以前拥有的一家公司支付超过 20 亿欧元（23 亿美元）的赔偿金，但该公司败诉。【原文：Raiffeisen Bank International AG lost its appeal of a court decision ordering it to pay more than €2 billion ($2.3 billion) of damages to a company formerly owned by sanctioned Russian billionaire Oleg Deripaska.】

item.title: 逆风袭来，Alphabet 为巨型股盈利定调
item.description: Alphabet Inc. 将为本季度的科技财报定下基调，而投资者担心这可能是一个无趣的音符。【原文：Alphabet Inc. will to set the tone for tech earnings this season, and investors are worried it may be a bum note.】

item.title: 华尔街的新现实是试图利用推文进行交易
item.description:
所有价格走势似乎都受到白宫政策的推动。【原文：

All price moves seem to be being driven by White House policies.

】

item.title: 维珍航空与 Starlink 和亚马逊洽谈 Wi-Fi 协议
item.description: 维珍大西洋航空公司（Virgin Atlantic Airways）正在与包括埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的 Starlink 公司在内的 Wi-Fi 提供商商讨，以便在本十年末全面改造机上互联网服务。【原文：Virgin Atlantic Airways is in discussions with Wi-Fi providers including with Elon Musk’s Starlink to overhaul its onboard internet service by the end of the decade.】

item.title: 西班牙将拨款 13 亿欧元应对住房危机
item.description: 西班牙首相佩德罗-桑切斯（Pedro Sanchez）试图通过改变房屋建造方式来解决日益严重的住房危机，西班牙将拨出 13 亿欧元（15 亿欧元）的专款用于建造新房。【原文：Spain is earmarking €1.3 billion (€1.5 billion) to build new houses as Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez tries to address a growing housing crisis by changing the way homes are built.】

item.title: 花旗集团在新加坡聘用前高盛高级银行家 Chris Chan
item.description: 新加坡高盛集团董事总经理兼董事会成员 Chris Chan 已离职，加入花旗集团，担任北亚和南亚金融机构市场解决方案主管。【原文：Chris Chan, a managing director and board member at Goldman Sachs Group Inc. in Singapore, has left to join Citigroup Inc. as head of markets solutions for financial institutions in north and south Asia.】

item.title: 凸版的芯片材料部门 Tekscend 据称计划今年上市
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，日本芯片材料制造商 Tekscend Photomask 公司正计划最快于今年下半年在东京进行首次公开募股。【原文：Japanese chip-material maker Tekscend Photomask Corp. is planning an initial public offering in Tokyo as soon as the second half of this year, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 富世华首席执行官认为贸易动荡将推动机器人割草机需求增长
item.description: 瑞典园艺产品制造商胡斯克瓦纳公司（Husqvarna AB）的目标是加强其在美国机器人割草机市场的地位，因为中国竞争对手在充满争议的贸易谈判中失去了优势。【原文：Swedish garden product manufacturer Husqvarna AB aims to strengthen its position in the US market for robotic lawn mowers as Chinese competitors lose ground amid fraught trade talks.】

item.title: 华尔街最大看涨者之一因关税影响而下调观点
item.description: 华尔街最大的牛市之一正在放弃对今年大幅上涨的预期，认为关税对美国企业的打击最大。【原文：One of Wall Street’s biggest bulls is throwing in the towel on expectations for large gains this year, seeing tariffs hitting corporate America the hardest.】

item.title: 雀巢和联合利华预示消费者将承受更多定价之痛
item.description: 联合利华（Unilever Plc）和雀巢（Nestle SA）第一季度的销售额好于预期，因为它们提高了价格以应对商品成本的飙升。【原文：Unilever Plc and Nestle SA posted better-than-expected sales in the first quarter after pushing up prices to counter surging commodity costs.】

item.title: 华尔街股票交易员通过图表寻找 S&P 500 指数下一步走势的线索
item.description: 最近几天，主要受美国总统唐纳德-特朗普在关税问题上一再转向的影响，美国股市剧烈波动，令华尔街许多人愤懑不已。【原文：In recent days, the wild swings in US stocks, largely driven by President Donald Trump’s repeated U-turns on tariffs, have caused many on Wall Street to throw up their hands in exasperation.】

item.title: Dymon 投资组合经理 Tang 在达到亏损上限后离职
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，戴蒙亚洲资本（Dymon Asia Capital）投资组合经理汉斯-唐（Hans Tang）将离开这家总部位于新加坡的对冲基金，因为他的兼并套利舱（merger arbitrage pod）达到了亏损上限，并被公司止损。【原文：Dymon Asia Capital portfolio manager Hans Tang is leaving the Singapore-based hedge fund after his merger arbitrage pod hit its loss limit and was stopped out by the firm, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 摩根大通晋升印度市场和公司销售主管为总经理
item.description: 摩根大通公司提升两位印度重要高管为常务董事。【原文：JPMorgan Chase & Co. elevated two key India executives as managing directors.】

item.title: 戴维森-坎普纳认为欧洲的缺陷是信贷机会
item.description: 价值 370 亿美元的全球投资公司 Davidson Kempner 认为，随着银行的撤退，欧洲的分散和市场效率低下实际上为灵活的资本提供者提供了极具吸引力的机会。【原文：Europe’s fragmentation and market inefficiencies actually offer attractive opportunities for flexible capital providers as banks retreat, according to Davidson Kempner, a $37-billion global investment firm.】

item.title: 乌克兰未能与对冲基金领导的集团重组认股权证
item.description: 乌克兰和以对冲基金为首的债权人集团未能在下月付款前就与经济增长相关的价值 32 亿美元债务的重组条款达成一致。【原文：Ukraine and a group of creditors led by hedge funds failed to agree on the restructuring terms for $3.2 billion worth of debt linked to economic growth, ahead of next month’s payment.】

item.title: 雷恩表示，欧洲央行必须保持灵活，不应排除更大幅度的减息政策
item.description: 欧洲央行理事会成员奥利-雷恩（Olli Rehn）表示，欧洲央行可能不得不进一步降低利率，而且不应排除更大幅度的降息。【原文：The European Central Bank will probably have to lower interest rates further and shouldn’t exclude a larger reduction, according to Governing Council member Olli Rehn.】

item.title: 印度 IT 企业利用人工智能促进销售增长，减少新员工数量
item.description: 拥有数百万员工的印度 IT 外包公司正在利用人工智能来提高效率，减少对更多员工的需求，从而实现业务增长。【原文：Indian IT outsourcing companies, which employ millions, are tapping artificial intelligence to boost efficiency and reduce the need for more workers to grow their business.】

item.title: 赞比亚可能在通胀保持稳定后暂停加息
item.description: 赞比亚 4 月份的年通胀率因食品成本上涨幅度放缓而持平，这为央行下月暂停加息提供了空间。【原文：Zambia’s annual inflation rate flatlined in April on a softer rise in food costs, providing room for the central bank to pause interest-rate increases next month.】

item.title: 外国基金连续第三周买入日本股票
item.description: 外国基金连续第三周买入日本股票，原因是对美国贸易谈判持乐观态度，而且有猜测称投资者正在分散对美国股票的投资。【原文：Foreign funds bought Japanese stocks for a third straight week on optimism over US trade talks, and amid speculation investors are diversifying away from US equities.】

item.title: 贸易不确定性加剧，德国企业预期下滑
item.description: 由于美国总统唐纳德-特朗普的关税给近期对公共开支大幅跃升的乐观情绪蒙上阴影，德国企业的经济前景恶化。【原文：German companies’ economic outlook deteriorated as US President Donald Trump’s tariffs overshadowed recent optimism about a huge jump in public spending.】

item.title: 印度基础设施贷款公司计划投资 20 亿美元发展离岸债务业务
item.description: 据熟知内情的人士透露，印度国家基础设施融资发展银行（NaBFID）正计划首次进军海外信贷市场，目标是在本财年通过贷款和债券筹集多达 20 亿美元的资金。【原文：India’s National Bank for Financing Infrastructure & Development, or NaBFID, is planning to enter the overseas credit market for the first time, and aims to raise as much as $2 billion through loans and bonds this financial year, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 日本最大人寿保险公司将减持日元债券
item.description: 日本最大的人寿保险公司计划减持国家主权债券，尽管较高的收益率吸引了更多的国内买家和海外投资者购买这种避险资产。【原文：Japan’s largest life insurer plans to reduce its holdings of the nation’s sovereign bonds, even as higher yields have attracted more domestic buyers and overseas investors to the haven asset.】

item.title: 在人工智能的帮助下，修复老化计算机系统的竞赛日趋白热化
item.description: Kresimir Mudrovcic 和他的程序员团队连续几个月都要花费大量时间来研究计算机代码，这些代码的年龄可能是机组最年轻成员年龄的三倍。【原文：Kresimir Mudrovcic and his team of programmers spend months on end trawling through computer code that can be three times as old as the crew’s youngest members.】

item.title: ETF 专家眼中的未来
item.description:
每年，业界的名人都会在 Exchange 会议上擦肩而过。以下是他们对未来发展的看法。【原文：

Every year, a who’s-who of the industry rub elbows at the Exchange conference. This is what they had to say about what’s coming.
